topic.title: Installing on a Linux / UNIX Server

section.title: Linux Installer
section.p:
To install using the Linux installer, follow these steps:
Make sure that your system meets the system requirements.
Download the Linux installer.
[Optional] Validate the integrity of the downloaded file by checking it against the MD5 sum published on the download page.
Run the installer and follow the instructions in the installation program.For example, open a shell, cd to the installation directory, and at the prompt type sh ./oxygen-32bit.sh or sh ./oxygen-64bit.sh, depending on which installer you downloaded.
Start using one of the following methods:
Use the oxygenauthordevelopersyncroSVNClient shortcut created by the installer.
From a command line, type sh oxygen.shsh oxygenAuthor.shsh oxygenDeveloper.shsh syncroSVNClient.sh. This file is located in the installation folder.
To license your copy of go to Help Register and enter your license information.

ol.li: Install on the server and make sure the script is executable and the installation directory is in the PATH of the users that need to use the application.

Make sure you allocate sufficient memory to by setting an appropriate value for the -Xmx parameter in the .sh startup script.The default value of the -Xmx parameter is 512 MB. To avoid performance issues with large documents, you may need to adjust it.
Make sure the X server processes located on the workstations allow connections from the server host. For this, use the xhost command.
Start telnet (or ssh) on the server host.
Start an xterm process with the display parameter set on the current workstation. For example: xterm -display workstationip:0.0.

Start by typing sh oxygen.sh
sh oxygenAuthor.sh sh oxygenDeveloper.sh
sh syncroSVNClient.sh from the command line. This file is located in the installation folder.
